content.question: Which of the following is the correct electron configuration for a ground-state atom of magnesium (atomic number <math alttext="12" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>12</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>)Â ?

choices.label: <math alttext="1 s 2, 2 s 2, 2 p 8" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><msup><mrow><mn>1</mn><mi>s</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mspace></mspace><msup><mrow><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mn>2</mn><mi>s</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><msup><mrow><mn>2</mn><mi>p</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>8</mn></mrow></msup></mrow></math>

<math alttext="1 s 2, 2 s 2, 3 s 2, 3 p 6" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><mn>1</mn><mi>s</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><msup><mrow><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mn>2</mn><mi>s</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><msup><mrow><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mn>3</mn><mi>s</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><msup><mrow><mn>3</mn><mi>p</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>6</mn></mrow></msup></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="1 s 2, 2 s 2, 2 p 6, 3 s 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><mn>1</mn><mi>s</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><msup><mrow><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mn>2</mn><mi>s</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><msup><mrow><mn>2</mn><mi>p</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>6</mn></mrow></msup><msup><mrow><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mn>3</mn><mi>s</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="1 s 2, 2 s 2, 3 s 4, 3 p 4" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><mn>1</mn><mi>s</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><msup><mrow><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mn>2</mn><mi>s</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><msup><mrow><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mn>3</mn><mi>s</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow></msup><msup><mrow><mn>3</mn><mi>p</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow></msup></mrow></mstyle></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="1 s 2, 2 s 2, 2 p 6, 3 s 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><mn>1</mn><mi>s</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><msup><mrow><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mn>2</mn><mi>s</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><msup><mrow><mn>2</mn><mi>p</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>6</mn></mrow></msup><msup><mrow><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mn>3</mn><mi>s</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow></mstyle></math>

skill.text: 1.A: Describe the components of and quantitative information from models and representations that illustrate particulate-level properties only.
